headline: Will ON Semiconductor’s (ON) $6 Billion Buyback Reveal New Priorities for Long-Term Capital Allocation?
summary: ON Semiconductor Corporation announced in the past week that its Board of Directors has authorized a new share repurchase program of up to US$6 billion, set to expire at the end of 2028. This significant buyback authorization is intended to begin after the current program expires and suggests increased confidence from management in the company’s long-term strategy across automotive, industrial, and AI data center markets. We'll explore how this substantial repurchase program signals...
